alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 4:21AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL THROUGH AROUND NOONTIME SUNDAY... Deep and moist southwesterly flow will continue through late Saturday afternoon/early Saturday evening. As a result, expect periods of rain to continue. There may be a drier period for much of Saturday evening through the overnight hours. Then another round of showers is possible after day break Sunday through noontime with a drying trend for Sunday afternoon/evening. Expected additional rainfall amounts through Saturday: Anchorage Bowl: 0.50" to 0.75" This additional rain could push small streams and creeks to, or slightly above, bankfull. Smaller rivers could see water levels rise to bankfull; however, water levels along larger rivers are expected to remain below bankfull. In urban areas, ponding of water and localized flooding on poorly drained roadways is also possible. Please use caution when driving or when recreating along or on area waterways. For additional information and updates to forecasts, please visit www.weather.gov/afc
